doc.previous: In the early 1980s, de Havilland Canada attempted to modify the Buffalo for civilian use. The aircraft was to be branded as the "Transporter." After loss of the demonstration aircraft (SN 103 C-GCTC) at the 1984 Farnborough Airshow, the project was abandoned.[citation needed]
doc.after: A production DHC-5D Buffalo was used for breaking time-to-height records for the weight category 12,000â16,000Â kg (26,430â35,242Â lb) on 16 February 1976, reaching 3,000Â m (9,836Â ft) in 2 min 12.75 sec, 6,000Â m (19,672Â ft) in 4 min 27.5 sec and 9,000Â m (29,508Â ft) in 8 min 3.5 sec.[5]
